alert.note: Alert for Lamoille (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 7:36AM EST until December 19 at 9:15PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Lamoille River At Jeffersonville affecting Lamoille County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lamoille River at Jeffersonville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...Until the river stage falls below 451.0 feet, water will continue to cover Route 15 in Cambridge Village at the Wrong Way Bridge. Widespread field flooding from Jeffersonville downstream through Fairfax will continue, and water will threaten the streets in Jeffersonville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 453.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM EST Tuesday was 453.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 445.5 feet late this evening. - Flood stage is 450.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 454.5 feet on 11/01/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 745 PM EST.
